text: [Music]
to create an agreement-based offer log
in and navigate to the aws marketplace
management portal and choose the
agreements tab
here is a list of customers with active
subscriptions to the sas contract
product on aws marketplace you can
identify the customer using the customer
account id or the private offer id of
their current subscription
indicate the applicable customer and
choose create agreement based offer
like private offers created in the
offers tab you can first give the
agreement-based offer a custom offer
name
next we will choose the new agreement
end date this customer's subscription
ends on november 19 2021.
you can choose to co-term this offer and
keep the end date the same or choose a
new agreement end date
next we will choose the dimensions and
quantity that the customer will
subscribe to this customer is currently
subscribed to one unit of the tier 1
dimension we can change the number of
units that this customer will subscribe
to for this dimension and add any
additional
if your product supports additional
usage you can dictate the price for each
additional usage dimension here
since all agreement-based offers are
created with the payment schedule we
will need to create a payment schedule
for the customer
any invoices that have billed from the
customer's previous subscription will
remain intact
if the customer has payments that have
not yet billed from their previous
subscription the payment schedule in the
agreement-based offer will replace their
previous payment schedule once the
customer accepts
if you would like the buyer to be billed
up front for their subscription to the
agreement-based offer you can schedule
the invoice date for today
this dictates that the buyer will be
billed upon subscription
next we will choose the eula if the
buyer does not need a change in the eula
we can keep the eula from their current
agreement we can also choose the public
eula for this product standard or
enterprise contract ulas or add a custom
ula
now we will mark this offer as a renewal
and choose the expiration date which
will dictate how long the customer has
to subscribe to the agreement-based
offer
please note that aws systems are in utc
time and best practice is to set the
expiration date for at least two weeks
now we will choose next to review the
offer
here we can review and confirm the
information in the agreement-based offer
is accurate and either go back and
modify the offer by choosing previous or
create the offer by choosing create
amendment offer
like offers created in the offers tab
the offer will be created within 45
minutes and available for you to send to
the customer from the offers tab of your
aws marketplace management portal once
the offer has been accepted it will be
available to view in the agreements tab
[Music]
